content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
Risk-on: low volatility 19.9% with mixed breadth (4/8 sectors positive) — constructive for cyclicals and carry. Volatility supportive but participation uneven, so stock selection matters.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Transportation and Construction are leading: THYAO (1W: +4.88% | 1M: +9.03%) ABOVE TREND and TKFEN (1W: +7.78% | 1M: +12.60%) ABOVE TREND. Technology/Telco shows follow-through: TTKOM (1W: +3.44% | 1M: +14.95%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Energy & Chemicals and Holding/Investment are lagging after sharp pullbacks: TUPRS (1W: -8.82% | 1M: +13.76%) CORRECTION and SAHOL (1W: -5.73% | 1M: +14.65%) CORRECTION. Banking is under pressure as well: AKBNK (1W: -5.17% | 1M: +16.74%) CORRECTION.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
TKFEN (1W: +7.78% | 1M: +12.60%) ABOVE TREND, AEFES (1W: +6.28% | 1M: +21.02%) ABOVE TREND, THYAO (1W: +4.88% | 1M: +9.03%) ABOVE TREND, TAVHL (1W: +4.20% | 1M: +11.97%) ABOVE TREND, SISE (1W: +3.84% | 1M: +19.21%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
TRALT (1W: -22.23% | 1M: +2.72%) CORRECTION, TRMET (1W: -14.66% | 1M: +12.09%) CORRECTION, ASELS (1W: -10.66% | 1M: +8.16%) CORRECTION, TUPRS (1W: -8.82% | 1M: +13.76%) CORRECTION, TSKB (1W: -5.82% | 1M: -2.96%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Upside momentum: TKFEN (1W: +7.78% | 1M: +12.60%) ABOVE TREND, AEFES (1W: +6.28% | 1M: +21.02%) ABOVE TREND, THYAO (1W: +4.88% | 1M: +9.03%) ABOVE TREND. Downside momentum concentrated in energy/defense: TRALT (1W: -22.23% | 1M: +2.72%) CORRECTION, TRMET (1W: -14.66% | 1M: +12.09%) CORRECTION.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Mixed and cautious: ISCTR (1W: +1.97% | 1M: +14.98%) ABOVE TREND and VAKBN (1W: +2.90% | 1M: +12.08%) ABOVE TREND show resilience, while AKBNK (1W: -5.17% | 1M: +16.74%) CORRECTION, YKBNK (1W: -5.30% | 1M: +1.65%) CORRECTION and TSKB (1W: -5.82% | 1M: -2.96%) BELOW TREND signal short-term dispersion.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Healthy cyclicals with idiosyncratic risk: EREGL (1W: +0.77% | 1M: +17.43%) ABOVE TREND, FROTO (1W: +2.77% | 1M: +18.09%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +1.41% | 1M: +15.23%) ABOVE TREND outperform, but ASELS (1W: -10.66% | 1M: +8.16%) CORRECTION highlights headline-driven volatility.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Under pressure and volatile: SISE (1W: +3.84% | 1M: +19.21%) ABOVE TREND is a standout, while TUPRS (1W: -8.82% | 1M: +13.76%) CORRECTION, OYAKC (1W: -5.40% | 1M: +9.09%) CORRECTION, TRMET (1W: -14.66% | 1M: +12.09%) CORRECTION and TRALT (1W: -22.23% | 1M: +2.72%) CORRECTION demand active risk control.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Tilt pro-cyclical: overweight Transportation, Construction and top Retail longs while trimming holdings in Energy & Chemicals and large holding names that underperformed. Keep position sizes disciplined and use recent weakness in select banks and energy names as tactical entry points with tight stop-losses.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
TKFEN (1W: +7.78% | 1M: +12.60%) ABOVE TREND for momentum continuation, TAVHL (1W: +4.20% | 1M: +11.97%) ABOVE TREND for travel demand, TUPRS (1W: -8.82% | 1M: +13.76%) CORRECTION for mean-reversion or further downside, AKBNK (1W: -5.17% | 1M: +16.74%) CORRECTION for banking flow shifts.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Transportation for momentum and earnings/capacity cues, Energy & Chemicals for margin and oil-price driven volatility, and Banking for rate/FX sensitivity and earnings whispers. Monitor retail for consumer resilience signals.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Volatility remains low at 19.9% — supportive for risk assets; watch USD/TRY moves, global risk sentiment and local macro prints (CPI, policy comments) as primary triggers. Index reaction to those headlines will determine whether risk-on expands (breakout) or narrows into select winners (pullback).

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Low-volatility, risk-on backdrop with mixed breadth favors cyclical, high-beta BIST50 names in Transportation, Construction and Retail while Energy, Holding and parts of Banking are correcting. Trade selectively: lean into confirmed ABOVE TREND names and use sharp corrections in energy/large caps for tactical opportunities with disciplined stops.
